title: A City's child
creator_credit: Brian Kavanagh, Experimental Film and Television Fund of the Australian Council for the Arts and Kavanagh Productions
brief_description: An award-winning dramatic treatment of individual loneliness in a large city. Monica Maughan plays a spinster approaching middle age who lives with a dominating mother. After the death of her mother, unable to make human contact, she slips into a fantasy world in which a small doll becomes her “daughter”. The film was shot on 16mm for about $30,000.
